Authors: Sung-Yuan Hsieh, Teik-Khiang Goh, Chang-Hsin Kuo
Title:
A taxonomic revision of Stanjehughesia (Chaetosphaeriaceae,
Sordariomycetes), with a description of S. kaohsiungensis from
Taiwan
Keywords:
Dematiaceous hyphomycetes, freshwater fungi, lignicolous
fungi, phylogeny, sporidesmium-complex
Abstract:
Stanjehughesia kaohsiungensis sp. nov. is described from
decaying wood submerged in freshwater streams of Taoyuan District,
Kaohsiung City, Taiwan. The phylogenetic relationship of Stanjehughesia
species was sought among representative taxa from related fungal
lineages in the Sordariomycetes using the LSU sequences. Molecular data
revealed the phylogenetic placement of S. kaohsiungensis in the
Chaetosphaeriaceae, and is distinct from Sporidesmiaceae. While the
genus Stanjehughesia may be polyphyletic, a synopsis of morphological
characters for accepted Stanjehughesia species and a taxonomic key to
these species are provided to ease identification.
